data.title: Excess (unnecessary) transformation of touch position
data.body:
_I'm personally think it's a bug. And as this place is suitable for discussions, I decided not to put this into Starling forum, but rather discuss right here_

So there's this code in starling.core::Starling class (onTouch method): https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/core/Starling.as

```
// move position into viewport bounds
globalX = mStage.stageWidth  * (globalX - mViewPort.x) / mViewPort.width;
globalY = mStage.stageHeight * (globalY - mViewPort.y) / mViewPort.height;
```

which later becomes Touch#globalX/globalY and, of course, affects how Touch#getLocation() works.  I think it's totally unnecessary and bad for two reasons:
1. Conceptually global coordinates stand for exactly GLOBAL coordinates. The only global we have is stage coordinates. Analog for native display list: if you transform your root (scale or rotate) then in some touch/mouse event stageX and stageY will still be global (in stage scope), not somehow magically converted according to root transformation.
2. Using these coordinates for touch tracking and gesture recognition. All the gesture recognition must be done using touches' global coordinates because this is how we interact with our physical touch surface.
   Example: Let's say we have typical touch scrolling. In common case we never start to scroll right away on the first finger movement because we might accidentally move finger a bit while we actually perform tap (click). So imagine we have transformed Starling viewport now, let's say scaled up twice. So this "slop" (min distance we need to move to begin pan gesture recognition and begin scrolling) will become twice larger! Which is not a good for UX since we have exactly the same physical screen and we use our fingers in exactly same old manner. But UI magically start to behave differently (imho worse in any case).

Don't forget that removing this transformation affects calculation of Touch#getLocation and DisplayObjectContainer#hitTest methods. Which won't make you happy for sure=) But really read carefully and try to understand.
- I'm not a Starling user yet, just inspecting the code since I'm adjusting my gesture recognizing library to work also with Starling. So maybe I miss something?

data.title: Check and protection for if null is passed to TextField constructor
data.body: If null is sent to the text property when creating a TextField, flash will error out when it tries to access the null variable when rendering.  This change checks if the 'text' property is null, and if so sets the internal variable to a blank string instead.

data.title: TextField createRenderContents
data.body:
Howdy,

In the latest Starling version, in the TextField method createRenderedConents():DisplayObject you have the following line:

``` javascript
if (mText.length == 0) return new Sprite();
```

However, for some reason that I can't yet track down (I will update when I figure out how to reproduce), mText is sometimes null or undefined, so when .length is accessed, it throws an error:

TypeError: Error #1009: Cannot access a property or method of a null object reference.
    at starling.text::TextField/createRenderedContents()[C:\Users\Travis\Adobe Flash Builder 4.6\FTT Library\starling\text\TextField.as:152]

To hold me over until this is fixed, i've added this above the mText.length line:

``` javascript
if (!mText) return new Sprite();
```

data.title: Missing the "starling_sheet.png" file

"Unable to transcode ../media/textures/starling_sheet.png". 
Maybe you had forgotten to upload this file under "textures" floder 
:-)

data.title: override onComplete of Tween class
vertex's color will be black forever if you set its vertex alpha to zero
data.body: When you call the Quad's _setVertexAlpha()_ function and set the alpha value to zero,the rgb will be zero forever.This problem caused by VertexData's _setColor()_ function.

data.title: starling.text.BitmapFont.as Parsing Error. ( Line 123 )
data.body:
Hi,

I've come across an instance where a .fnt XML exported from GlyphDesigner includes kerning information for a character that isn't defined in the <chars> block.

The BitmapFont class throws a null reference error in the parseFontXml() method in the BitmapFont class.
As it doesn't check if a BitmapChar exists when calling getChar( id ) to insert the kerning info.

Its an easy fix!

Cheers,

Jamie

data.title: The "i am a descendant of myself" Paradox
data.body:
Possible bug leading to infinite display list recursion - I've just had a quick look at the Starling source code for the DisplayObject and DisplayObjectContainer classes, and I couldn't see any checks being done (when adding a child to a container) to determine if the child is being added to its own display list.

ChildA -> ChildB -> ChildC -> ChildA ...

I haven't run any tests, so I apologise if I've overlooked something, but I thought I would mention this while I was here.

data.title: Fixed bug where buttonMode on flash display objects is broken
data.body: After setting the handcursor functionality in starling sprites and buttons, using buttonMode on flash displayObjects no longer displays a hand cursor. This fix restores the buttonMode functionality.

data.title: Bitmap font performance too slow
data.body:
For some reasons, text fields that are backed up by a bitmap font are not as fast as they should be, as described here:

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/bitmap-font-composed-textfields-are-much-slower-than-device-rendered-tfs

data.title: override addChildAt causes infinite ADDED event
Only apply the translation once on childless DisplayObjectContainers
data.body: When DisplayObjectContainers without children calculate their bounds, they get a Matrix relative to the target space that includes their translation. Then the translation is included again in the calculation of the position by the matrix. This change removes the translation from the call to the matrix.

data.title: Add a simple ant build
data.body: With this one can run "ant -Dflexsdk.dir=path to your flex sdk" in the starling directory and the swc will be built as dist/starling.swc. You can also set a FLEX_HOME environment variable to keep from having to supply the -Dflexsdk.dir arg every time. I think this should make it easier for new contributors to get started building the project.

data.title: HOVER event is not fired when other display object comes over
data.body:
I made a button that shows different state with BEGAN, ENDED, MOVED, HOVER(over & out).
after click a button,
half transparent sprite covers button.
then that button remains HOVER(over) state
because mouse is not moved and HOVER event is not fired.

data.title: Touch event does not handle ENDED out of screen
data.body: When I have a drag event and release the mouse button outside the stage, touch events are still in MOVED phase when the cursor is moved back into the stage, even though the button is not pressed anymore. Also, ENDED is never fired.

data.title: Tween API improvements
data.body:
Tween methods currently all return void and require to write lots of code for simple things.

That's a big missed opportunity to allow chaining for cheap by just returning the tween instance, so your Tween example could look like:

new Tween(object, 2.0, Transitions.EASE_IN_OUT)
    .animate("x", object.x + 50)
    .animate("rotation", deg2rad(45))
    .fadeTo(0)    // equivalent to 'animate("alpha", 0)'
    .run(); // equivalent to Starling.juggler.add(tween);

Add a static helper and you have an all modern API:
Tween.select(object, 2.0, Transitions.EASE_IN_OUT).fadeTo(1).run();

data.title: Error #2183 when rendering a displayObject with scaleX or scaleY = 0
Update starling/src/starling/animation/Juggler.as
data.body: FIxed Juggler range error when removing movieclip from it

data.title: currentFrame range is different from numFrames
data.body:
I guess range of .currentFrame is 0 ~ n-1.
and .numFrames is n.

n = mTextures.length

so this causes little bit confusing.

data.title: Using StageScaleMode.NO_SCALE in IE will result in an exception (Error #3669 at flash.display3D::Context3D/configureBackBuffer())
data.body:
Hi,
I have a bug which occur in IE (IE9 at least but it seems like a common IE problem). If I use this line:
stage.scaleMode = StageScaleMode.NO_SCALE;
Then I get an exception during Starling init:

Error: Error #3669: Taille d’entrée incorrecte.
at flash.display3D::Context3D/configureBackBuffer()
at starling.core::Starling/updateViewPort()[D:\workspaces\Flex\Flex_4.5_branch\StarlingLib\src\starling\core\Starling.as:233]
at starling.core::Starling/initializeGraphicsAPI()[D:\workspaces\Flex\Flex_4.5_branch\StarlingLib\src\starling\core\Starling.as:209]
at starling.core::Starling/onContextCreated()[D:\workspaces\Flex\Flex_4.5_branch\StarlingLib\src\starling\core\Starling.as:318]

When you get into the code, you can notice that the stageWidth and stageHeight are both at 0. It looks like a swfobject.js + IE problem, see this thread: http://www.actionscript.org/forums/showthread.php3?t=128143

Solution is to listen for the Event.RESIZE event on the stage passed to Starling and initialize the viewport once both dimensions are not zero. From my tests, it takes 2 resize events to get the correct dimensions.

Fabien

data.title: Missing handle for 'bold' in TextField constructor
Resize event width and height don't match stage.stageWidth and stage.height
Allow multiple Starling instances
data.body:
Currently, there's a problem when you've got several Starling instances (either simultaneously or one after the other). More information can be found here:

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/multiple-starlings-error-another-program-with-this-name-is-already-registered

data.title: Set texture property in Image class ignores texture frame
data.body: As reported here: http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/image-component-changing-texture

data.title: DataEvent class
data.body:
Hello,

I know it's trivial, but while you're reimplementing the event dispatching model in Starling API you might as well include a DataEvent class.

data.title: Pull request for Starling Framework
data.body:
Check if context3D is null before call mStage3D.requestContext3D();
Add hasBitmapFont() method to TextField class.

data.title: Change HOVER phase implementation in Multitouch emulation mode
data.body:
When emulating multitouch, the HOVER phase is misleading:

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/simulatemultitouch-bug-in-values

Evaluate what to do against it; perhaps the HOVER phase should be removed altogether when multitouch is simulated.

EDIT: environments like the Wii allow 2 cursors with HOVER phase, so it would make sense to implement the HOVER phase on all cursors instead.

data.title: Fix for issue #44, missing embed when compiling against the framework as a source library.
data.body:
This patch is one possible fix for the touch_marker.png embed in TouchMarker.as being un-locatable when Starling-Framework is compiled into the source of an application.

It simply changes the embed path to an absolute path, allowing the media directory to be added as another source path to the project (the equivalent of passing `-source-path+=Starling-Framework/starling/media` to mxmlc or compc - the exact method of specifying a source path varies from IDE to IDE).

This solution allows the binary embed data to remain in a different tree than the source code.

data.title: Use relative paths for embedded assets
data.body: The texture that is used for the multitouch helper is included with an absolute path, which breaks compilation when the project is set up in a different way than expected (e.g. when it's included directly in a game).

data.title: Memory Leak in Starling
data.body:
There is a memory leak within the Starling Framework.  Create a very basic Starling project with a main flash.display.Sprite class that instantiates Starling and a main starling.display.Sprite class and then start Starling within the profile (Flash Builder) without any other added objects.  Peak memory keeps slowly climbing. 

Reference image:  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/189315/Starling_Leak.png
